the new financial accounting standards fasb board was created in 1972 replace to the accounting principles of the american of certified public accountants institute board
of the former board 's members all were cpas provoking conflict-of-interest criticism because they were writing rules while handling clients ' books at the same time
the others were the new board 's seven-member structure kept four cpas but from industry and academia
francis m. wheat a former securities and exchange commission member headed the that had studied the issues for a year and proposed the fasb on 30 march 1972 panel
its chairman had the former board had produced 21 opinions and 1,000 critics in its 12-year life conceded
the climate was right for the new fasb
some cpas failed in the late 1960s correct to such as clients picking permissive that hyped earnings and stock prices rules abuses
congress had and in 1970 november passed a special act overrule to one board rule
james needham an sec commissioner had also in 1972 april warned that the industry might face a federal writing accounting rules agency if they rejected the fasb idea
of the books dubbed figure filberts keepers loathed the threat
